targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

panels.title: CPU

panels.description: Memory Stack

targets.legendFormat: PageTables - Memory dedicated to the lowest page table level
SwapCache - Swap used as cache memory
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use
Cache - Physical RAM used as cache memory
Buffers - Physical RAM used for file buffers
Committed - The amount of memory presently allocated on the system
Mapped - Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
VmallocUsed - Memory of used virtual address space
Commit Limit - Total amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Unevictable - Unevictable pages can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons

panels.title: Memory Stack

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used

targets.legendFormat: Committed - The amount of memory presently allocated on the system
Mapped - Files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
VmallocUsed - Memory of used virtual address space
Commit Limit - Total amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Unevictable - Unevictable pages can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
Shared mem - Total memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs
MLocked - Pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Active File - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Inactive File - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
VmallocChunk - Largest contiguous block of vmalloc area which is free
VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used
HugePages Free - Number of huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
HugePages Reserved - Number of huge pages for                 which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made,                 but no allocation has yet been made
HugePages Surp - Number of huge pages in                 the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap4K  - Amount of pages mapped as this size
Anon Huge Pages - Non-file backed huge pages mapped into userspace page tables
Anon Pages - Non-file backed pages mapped into userspace page tables
Inactive Anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
NFS Unstable - NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage
Processes blocked waiting for I/O to complete
Start time of the process since unix epoch in seconds

panels.description: The total number of bytes read / write successfully.
panels.title: Disk R/W

panels.description: Total number of reads / writes completed successfully
panels.title: Disk IOs

panels.description: The total number of milliseconds spent by all reads / writes.
panels.title: Disk R/W miliseconds

panels.description: The weighted # of milliseconds spent doing I/Os. This field is incremented at each I/O start, I/O completion, I/O  merge, or read of these stats by the number of I/Os in progress times the number of milliseconds spent doing I/O since the last update of this field. This can provide an easy measure of both I/O completion time and the backlog that may be accumulating.
panels.title: Disk IOs weighted

panels.description: The total number of  reads merged. See https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/iostats.txt.
panels.title: Disk R/W Merged

panels.description: The number of I/Os currently in progress.
panels.title: Disk IOs current in progress

panels.description: The total number of reads / writes completed successfully. See https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/iostats.txt.
panels.title: Disk R/W completed

panels.description: Milliseconds spent doing I/Os.
panels.title: Milliseconds spent doing I/Os

panels.description: The total number of sectors read successfully.
panels.title: Sectors read / write succesfully

panels.description: 1 if there was an error opening or reading a file, 0 otherwise
panels.title: Open error file

panels.description: Filesystem space available to non-root users in bytes. Filesystem free space in bytes. Filesystem read-only status. Filesystem size in bytes.
panels.title: Filesystem space available

panels.description: Filesystem total file nodes.
panels.title: File nodes

panels.title: File descriptor

panels.description: Filesystem read-only status.
panels.title: Filesystem in ReadOnly

targets.legendFormat: CurrEstab - Number of TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
InErrs - Number of segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)
InSegs - Number of segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections
OutRsts - Number of TCP segments sent containing the RST flag
OutSegs - Number of segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets
RetransSegs - Number of segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
AttemptFails - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT and SYN-RCVD
EstabResets - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
RtoAlgorithm - Algorithm used to determine the timeout value used for retransmitting unacknowledged octets
RtoMax - Maximum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds
RtoMin - Minimum value permitted by a TCP implementation for the retransmission timeout, measured in milliseconds

targets.legendFormat: InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
OutRedirects -  Redirect messages sent. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects
InCsumErrors - Messages with ICMP checksum errors
InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
OutErrors - Messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers
InDestUnreachs - ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received
OutDestUnreachs - ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent
InTimeExcds - ICMP Time Exceeded messages received
OutTimeExcds - ICMP Time Exceeded messages sent
InEchoReps - ICMP Echo Reply messages received
OutEchoReps - ICMP Echo Reply messages sent
InTimestampReps - ICMP Timestamp Reply messages received
OutTimestampReps - ICMP Timestamp Reply messages sent
InAddrMaskReps - ICMP Address Mask Reply messages received
InAddrMasks - ICMP Address Mask Request messages received
OutAddrMaskReps - ICMP Address Mask Reply messages sent
OutAddrMasks - ICMP Address Mask Request messages sent
InParmProbs - ICMP Parameter Problem messages received
OutParmProb - ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent
InSrcQuenchs - ICMP Source Quench messages received
OutSrcQuenchs - ICMP Source Quench messages sent
